definitions.definition: To work something with a chisel.
examples: She chiselled a sculpture out of the block of wood.

definitions.definition: To barge in on (something); to intrude on (something).
To make small changes to (something), bit by bit , resulting in change over time.
examples: Laws that protect the environment are being chiseled away.

definitions.definition: To beg or pressure somebody into giving up (something); to haggle excessively; to cheat; to obtain something from (someone) by cheating.
examples: He's managed to chisel a couple dollars from somewhere.
She can always chisel whatever she needs from her father.
She's always either chiseling or groveling, it seems.

secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To work something with a chisel.
( transitive , dated ) To barge in on (something); to intrude on (something).
( transitive , figurative ) To make small changes to (something), bit by bit , resulting in change over time.
( ambitransitive , informal ) To beg or pressure somebody into giving up (something); to haggle excessively; to cheat; to obtain something from (someone) by cheating.
